metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27218 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in GNOME GLib before 2.66.7 and 2.67.x before 2.67.4. If g_byte_array_new_take() was called with a buffer of 4GB or more on a 64-bit platform, the length would be truncated modulo 2**32, causing unintended length truncation.

criterions.comment: glib2.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
